description.value:
Trigger A creature begins to play the vidgame

Effect The trap attempts to pull all players into the vidgame. Each player must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and can play the game from the safety of reality.

Success The creature is pulled into the game for 1 round, then immediately escapes the game, returning to reality.

Failure The creature is pulled into the game and can't escape the game until the trap is disabled.

Critical Failure The creature is pulled into the game and can't escape the game until the trap is disabled. Unfortunately, it's playing on hard mode, and it treats the DC of the trap's routine as 2 higher.

If the vidgame console is turned off, all creatures inside the vidgame remain inside the vidgame and are temporarily removed from reality. If the vidgame console is turned back on, these creatures continue the game where they left off.

details.description: A hyperrealistic vidgame pulls players into a virtual world, transforming them into pixelated avatars and pitting them against deadly challenges.
details.disable: @Check[computers|dc:22] (trained) to reprogram the game, or @Check[thievery|dc:22] (trained) to exploit a glitch, or @Check[Vidgame Lore|dc:17] (trained) to beat the game; four total successes are required to disable the trap
details.routine: (1 action) The trap presents the game's players with deadly challenges as 1 action. Each creature inside the game takes @Damage[(2d8+5)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). A creature can attempt a Vidgame Lore check in place of their saving throw, if desired.
